title: Static equilibrium - board in a corner

content.description: One end of a thin, uniform board of weight <math alttext="10.0 newtons" overflow="scroll"><mn>10.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> and length <math alttext="80 centimeters" overflow="scroll"><mn>80</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math> rests against the corner of a horizontal floor and a vertical wall. The other end of the board is supported by a cable that is attached to the wall, at a point <math alttext="160 centimeters" overflow="scroll"> <mn>160</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mi>cm</mi> </math> directly above the corner. The cable is attached to the board at an angle of <math alttext="90 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mn>90</mn><mo>Â°</mo></math>.
content.question: What is the tension in the cable?

topic.text: 5.5: Rotational Equilibrium and Newton's First Law in Rotational Form

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
